p: Oil extraction was performed according to the AOAC method Am2-93 [ 29]. About 250 g of C. integerrima seeds were extracted using n-hexane (150 mL) as an extraction solvent in a Soxhlet apparatus. After 8 h, the n-hexane was removed by distillation under reduced pressure at 40 °C. The obtained C. integerrima orange oil (CIO) was stored at 4 °C under inert atmosphere until further investigation. The extraction was performed in triplicate for each harvested sample, obtaining a 26% yield. The same procedure was used for the C. salicifolia but, in this case, the oil (CSO) obtained had a yellow coloration with 23% of yield.
